title: Ultimate Language Shootout IV: Haskell or: How a List Comprehension Is Like a Burrito
summary: It's a compiled, statically typed, lazy, purely functional programming language. About as far as possible from Python? Not quite. The languages have a lot in common and Python has already borrowed a few tricks from Haskell.
